name: Stop touching my ball!
description:
Shooting pool is fun, but waiting for your opponent to shoot isn't. The solution is called "Stop touching my ball".

The game is meant to be played on a phone but works on a computer too.

Click and hold (or touch your screen) and drag to aim.  Hold "space" or the on screen button to build power. Release to shoot.

The goal is to sink all the red balls before the opponent sinks the yellow ones.

The game was made entirely on a phone. The coding was done in the app Play.js, the 3d modelling was done in Nomad Sculpt and the audio was made in GarageBand. The game is built using React-Three/Fiber with the React-Three/Cannon physics engine.

"Stop touching my ball" was made for the Game Dev Field Guide Monthly Game Jam 15 and took roughly 70 hours to make.
